name: YesYous
tag_list: project-sharing, social-network, student, university, collaboration, digital-resume
overview:
YesYous is the first site enables students to easily and effectively showcase their school projects by linking their posted project to their teammates/collaborators and advisers.

Students use YesYous as an expanded resume, to help demonstrate to employers that they actively participated in group projects in school and to showcase the quality of the work they created. Whether applying to a grad school or a job, when its a close race students with YesYous have an edge.

milestones.description: YesYous opens its first student competition, in which CSUF and UC Berkeley students enter into 'Project Popularity Contest'.  The project with the most votes wins $1,000
milestones.source_description: $1,000 CASH PRIZE OFFERED TO STUDENTS IN ‘PROJECT POPULARITY CONTEST

milestones.description: YY opens 'Project Popularity Contest' in which students from CSU Fullerton and UC Berkeley compete to win $1,000 cash. Students vote for their favorite project, the project with the most votes at the end of the contest wins!
milestones.source_description: $1,000 CASH PRIZE OFFERED TO STUDENTS IN ‘PROJECT POPULARITY CONTEST'
